question.title: Long startup times for Java Language support in VS Code with Flutter project
question.body:
I have a top-level folder project that contains folders named mobile and server. Inside the mobile folder is a Flutter app, and inside the server folder is a Spring Boot app.

When I open the project folder in Visual Studio Code, the Java Language extension tells me that it's "Opening Java Projects" which takes an extremely long time. Recently it's started causing an OutOfMemoryException. I am using version 0.29.1 of the Extension Pack for Java from Microsoft.

I've noticed while it's importing it says it's Configuring projects :device_info_plus. That is a Flutter package, so it seems like it should be ignored. It does this for many if not all of the Flutter packages the project is using.

At the suggestion of Google search / ChapGPT, I added the following configuration to project/.vscode/settings.json:

"java.project.resourcesFilters": [
  "android/"
]

Unfortunately this hasn't changed the behavior.

I stumbled upon a log file in AppData\Roaming\Code\User\workspaceStorage\...\redhat.java\jdt_ws\.metadata\.log which has entries in it like this:

!MESSAGE Could not write metadata for '/path_provider_android'.
!STACK 0
java.io.FileNotFoundException: very log path\3.tree (The system cannot find the path specified)

I'm not sure if this is related.

Should the Java Language server be processing Flutter packages?

  • If not, what is the proper resourceFilter path to specify that will prevent them from being processed?
  • If so, is there any way to speed up the start up time for opening up this folder?

question_comments.body: What is a long time? Share actual times. Also if you have a stack trace of the OutOfMemoryException share it. edit the question to add information. What is the structure of the project? Version of Visual Code? A minimal reproducible example would be useful.
